thread.title: San Francisco Giants pitcher Ryan Vogelsong to be honored by PSAC, Kutztown University
thread.title_full: San Francisco Giants pitcher Ryan Vogelsong to be honored by PSAC, Kutztown University - The Morning Call

author: mcall.com
title: San Francisco Giants pitcher Ryan Vogelsong to be honored by PSAC, Kutztown University
text:
Former Kutztown University pitcher and two-time MLB World Series champion Ryan Vogelsong will be honored Saturday by the Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference and the Kutztown president's office at a private ceremony. His No. 14 jersey will be retired during halftime of Kutztown's Homecoming football game at Andre Reed Stadium.
Vogelsong will receive the PSAC Award of Merit, presented to individuals with an affiliation with a league school, either as an alumnus, coach or administrator. It is given for outstanding and extraordinary accomplishments or services that bring exceptional recognition and honor to the conference.
The Kutztown President's Medal was created in 2014 to celebrate and honor select individuals who have devoted their time, talent and treasure to allow Kutztown University to fulfill its mission and reach its goals. This is the third medal awarded by the president's office. Past recipients include William F. Ribble '73 and Andre Reed '05.
Vogelsong, a 2005 inductee to the KU Athletics Hall of Fame, was a stellar pitcher and third baseman for the Kutztown baseball team from 1996-98. He will be the first KU baseball player to have his number retired.
Lehigh's Beckman, Brown to compete at NWCA All-Star Classic
Two returning Lehigh All-Americans have been selected to compete in the 50th annual Hire Heroes NWCA All-Star Classic on Nov. 1, at McCamish Pavilion on the campus of Georgia Tech in Atlanta.
Senior Mason Beckman will make his third consecutive All-Star Classic appearance at 133 pounds. Senior Nathaniel Brown will compete at 184 in his first All-Star appearance.
Last year's NCAA runner-up at 184, Brown will face Edinboro's Vic Avery. Brown was 29-6 in 2014-15, earning his first All-America medal after reaching the national finals. He carries a 67-19 record into his senior season. In addition to his second-place NCAA finish, Brown took second at the EIWA Championships and third at the Southern Scuffle.
Brown and Avery met once last season, with Brown earning a 3-1 decision at Grapple at the Garden in New York. Avery reached the NCAA semifinals last season and finished third at 184.
